app.title: App
app.description: Configuration of an default app that is part of the cluster.

extraConfigs.title: Extra config maps or secrets
extraConfigs.description: Extra config maps or secrets that will be used to customize to the app. The desired values must be under configmap or secret key 'values'. The values are merged in the order given, with the later values overwriting earlier, and then inline values overwriting those. Resources must be in the same namespace as the cluster.

kind.title: Kind
kind.description: Specifies whether the resource is a config map or a secret.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the config map or secret. The object must exist in the same namespace as the cluster App.

optional.title: Optional
optional.description: Optional marks this ValuesReference as optional. When set, a not found error for the values reference is ignored, but any ValuesKey, TargetPath or transient error will still result in a reconciliation failure.

values.title: Values
values.description: Values to be passed to the app. Values will have higher priority than values from configmaps.

additionalSecurityGroups.title: Machine pool additional security groups
additionalSecurityGroups.description: Additional security groups that will be added to the machine pool nodes.

id.title: Id of the security group
id.description: ID of the security group that will be added to the machine pool nodes. The security group must exist.

instanceTypeOverrides.title: Instance type overrides
instanceTypeOverrides.description: Ordered list of instance types to be used for the machine pool. The first instance type that is available in the region will be used. Read more in our docs https://docs.giantswarm.io/advanced/cluster-management/node-pools-capi/

instanceWarmup.title: Time interval, in seconds, between node replacement.

minHealthyPercentage.title: Minimum percentage of instances that must remain healthy during node replacement.

spotInstances.title: Spot instances
spotInstances.description: Compared to on-demand instances, spot instances can help you save cost.

maxPrice.title: Maximum price to pay per instance per hour, in USD.

subnetTags.title: Subnet tags
subnetTags.description: Tags to filter which AWS subnets will be used for this node pool.

cluster.title: Cluster
cluster.description: Helm values for the provider-independent cluster chart

global.title: Global
global.description: Properties that are available to all charts and subcharts.

apps.title: Apps
apps.description: Configuration of apps that are part of the cluster.

awsCloudControllerManager.title: AWS cloud controller manager
awsCloudControllerManager.description: Configuration of aws-cloud-controller-manager-app. For all available values see https://github.com/giantswarm/aws-cloud-controller-manager-app.

awsEbsCsiDriver.title: AWS EBS CSI driver
awsEbsCsiDriver.description: Configuration of aws-ebs-csi-driver-app. For all available values see https://github.com/giantswarm/aws-ebs-csi-driver-app.

cilium.title: Cilium
cilium.description: Configuration of cilium-app. For all available values see https://github.com/giantswarm/cilium-app.

coreDns.title: CoreDNS
coreDns.description: Configuration of coredns-app. For all available values see https://github.com/giantswarm/coredns-app.

networkPolicies.title: NetworkPolicies
networkPolicies.description: Configuration of network-policies-app. For all available values see https://github.com/giantswarm/network-policies-app.

verticalPodAutoscalerCrd.title: Vertical-pod-autoscaler CRD
verticalPodAutoscalerCrd.description: Configuration of vertical-pod-autoscaler-crd-app. For all available values see https://github.com/giantswarm/vertical-pod-autoscaler-crd.

components.title: Components
components.description: Advanced configuration of components that are running on all nodes.

containerRegistries.title: Container registries
containerRegistries.description: Endpoints and credentials configuration for container registries.

auth.title: Auth
auth.description: Base64-encoded string from the concatenation of the username, a colon, and the password.

identitytoken.title: Identity token
identitytoken.description: Used to authenticate the user and obtain an access token for the registry.

password.title: Password
password.description: Used to authenticate for the registry with username/password.

username.title: Username
username.description: Used to authenticate for the registry with username/password.

availabilityZoneUsageLimit.title: Availability zones
availabilityZoneUsageLimit.description: Maximum number of availability zones (AZ) that should be used in a region. If a region has more than this number of AZs then this number of AZs will be picked randomly when creating subnets.

ipamMode.title: IPAM mode (IP allocation strategy)
ipamMode.description: Use `eni` for ENI (AWS Elastic Network Interfaces) allocation of IPs in Cilium (https://docs.cilium.io/en/latest/network/concepts/ipam/eni/). The default is `kubernetes` (https://docs.cilium.io/en/latest/network/concepts/ipam/kubernetes/). WARNING: The `eni` feature is currently in an early stage and there might be breaking changes in the future. The networking infrastructure will be made consistent with our vintage cluster implementations so that pod IPs are placed in a secondary VPC CIDR.

resolverRulesOwnerAccount.title: Resolver rules owner
resolverRulesOwnerAccount.description: ID of the AWS account that created the resolver rules to be associated with the workload cluster VPC.

eniModePodSubnets.title: Pod Subnets for Cilium ENI mode
eniModePodSubnets.description: Pod subnets are created and tagged based on this definition. **Only used for `global.connectivity.cilium.ipamMode=eni`** which puts pods on a secondary CIDR block in the VPC, and therefore requires separate subnets. The subnets must be tagged with `sigs.k8s.io/cluster-api-provider-aws/association=secondary` to be correctly handled by CAPA (so those subnets aren't accidentally chosen for nodes). These subnets are always private.

cidr.title: Address range
cidr.description: IPv4 address range, in CIDR notation.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: AWS resource tags to assign to this subnet.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: AWS resource tags to assign to this CIDR block.

internetGatewayId.title: Internet Gateway ID
internetGatewayId.description: ID of the Internet gateway for the VPC.

cidrBlocks.title: Pod subnets
cidrBlocks.description:
CIDR blocks used for pods. Right now, only one block is supported.

**Note if you use `global.connectivity.cilium.ipamMode=eni` (https://docs.cilium.io/en/latest/network/concepts/ipam/eni/#ipam-eni):** this will be associated as secondary VPC CIDR. Therefore, only sizes /16 to /28 sizes are possible (see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/vpc-cidr-blocks.html). And `global.connectivity.eniModePodSubnets` must be a valid split of the CIDR you chose here – we recommend setting `10.1.0.0/16` here for ENI mode because the default values for `global.connectivity.eniModePodSubnets` match that CIDR.

items.title: Pod subnet
items.description: IPv4 address range for pods, in CIDR notation.

items.title: Service subnet
items.description: IPv4 address range for kubernetes services, in CIDR notation.

vpcCidr.title: VPC subnet
vpcCidr.description: IPv4 address range to assign to this cluster's VPC, in CIDR notation.

vpcId.title: VPC id
vpcId.description: ID of the VPC, where the cluster will be deployed. The VPC must exist and it case this is set, VPC wont be created by controllers.

proxy.title: Proxy
proxy.description: Whether/how outgoing traffic is routed through proxy servers.

httpProxy.title: HTTP proxy
httpProxy.description: To be passed to the HTTP_PROXY environment variable in all hosts.

httpsProxy.title: HTTPS proxy
httpsProxy.description: To be passed to the HTTPS_PROXY environment variable in all hosts.

noProxy.title: No proxy
noProxy.description: To be passed to the NO_PROXY environment variable in all hosts.

subnets.title: Subnets
subnets.description: Subnets are created and tagged based on this definition.

cidr.title: Address range
cidr.description: IPv4 address range, in CIDR notation.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: AWS resource tags to assign to this subnet.

id.title: ID of the subnet
id.description: ID of an existing subnet. When set, this subnet will be used instead of creating a new one.

natGatewayId.title: ID of the NAT Gateway
natGatewayId.description: ID of the NAT Gateway used for this existing subnet.

routeTableId.title: ID of route table
routeTableId.description: ID of the route table, assigned to the existing subnet. Must be provided when defining subnet via ID.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: AWS resource tags to assign to this CIDR block.

topology.title: Topology
topology.description: Networking architecture between management cluster and workload cluster.

prefixListId.title: Prefix list ID
prefixListId.description: ID of the managed prefix list to use when the topology mode is set to 'UserManaged'.

transitGatewayId.title: Transit gateway ID
transitGatewayId.description: If the topology mode is set to 'UserManaged', this can be used to specify the transit gateway to use.

vpcEndpointMode.title: VPC endpoint mode
vpcEndpointMode.description: Who is reponsible for creation and management of VPC endpoints.

vpcMode.title: VPC mode
vpcMode.description: Whether the cluser's VPC is created with public, internet facing resources (public subnets, NAT gateway) or not (private).

additionalSecurityGroups.title: Control Plane additional security groups
additionalSecurityGroups.description: Additional security groups that will be added to the control plane nodes.

id.title: Id of the security group
id.description: ID of the security group that will be added to the control plane nodes. The security group must exist.

apiExtraArgs.title: API extra arguments
apiExtraArgs.description: Extra arguments passed to the kubernetes API server.

apiExtraCertSANs.title: API extra cert SANs
apiExtraCertSANs.description: Extra certs SANs passed to the kubeadmcontrolplane CR.

apiMode.title: API mode
apiMode.description: Whether the Kubernetes API server load balancer should be reachable from the internet (public) or internal only (private).

apiServerPort.title: API server port
apiServerPort.description: The API server Load Balancer port. This option sets the Spec.ClusterNetwork.APIServerPort field on the Cluster CR. In CAPI this field isn't used currently. It is instead used in providers. In CAPA this sets only the public facing port of the Load Balancer. In CAPZ both the public facing and the destination port are set to this value. CAPV and CAPVCD do not use it.

loadBalancerIngressAllowCidrBlocks.title: Load balancer allow list
loadBalancerIngressAllowCidrBlocks.description: IPv4 address ranges that are allowed to connect to the control plane load balancer, in CIDR notation. When setting this field, remember to add the Management cluster Nat Gateway IPs provided by Giant Swarm so that the cluster can still be managed. These Nat Gateway IPs can be found in the Management Cluster AWSCluster '.status.networkStatus.natGatewaysIPs' field.

nodeStartupTimeout.title: Node startup timeout
nodeStartupTimeout.description: Determines how long a machine health check should wait for a node to join the cluster, before considering a machine unhealthy.

unhealthyNotReadyTimeout.title: Timeout for ready
unhealthyNotReadyTimeout.description: If a node is not in condition 'Ready' after this timeout, it will be considered unhealthy.

unhealthyUnknownTimeout.title: Timeout for unknown condition
unhealthyUnknownTimeout.description: If a node is in 'Unknown' condition after this timeout, it will be considered unhealthy.

caPem.title: Certificate authority
caPem.description: Identity provider's CA certificate in PEM format.

issuerUrl.title: Issuer URL
issuerUrl.description: Exact issuer URL that will be included in identity tokens.

subnetTags.title: Subnet tags
subnetTags.description: Tags to select AWS resources for the control plane by.

managementCluster.title: Management cluster
managementCluster.description: Name of the Cluster API cluster managing this workload cluster.

description.title: Cluster description
description.description: User-friendly description of the cluster's purpose.

name.title: Cluster name
name.description: Unique identifier, cannot be changed after creation.

servicePriority.title: Service priority
servicePriority.description: The relative importance of this cluster.

nodePools.title: Node pools
nodePools.description: Node pools of the cluster. If not specified, this defaults to the value of `cluster.providerIntegration.workers.defaultNodePools`.

additionalResourceTags.title: Additional resource tags
additionalResourceTags.description: Additional tags to add to AWS resources created by the cluster.

ami.title: Amazon machine image (AMI)
ami.description: If specified, this image will be used to provision EC2 instances.

awsClusterRoleIdentityName.title: Cluster role identity name
awsClusterRoleIdentityName.description: Name of an AWSClusterRoleIdentity object. Learn more at https://docs.giantswarm.io/getting-started/cloud-provider-accounts/cluster-api/aws/#configure-the-awsclusterroleidentity .

flatcarAwsAccount.title: AWS account owning Flatcar image
flatcarAwsAccount.description: AWS account ID owning the Flatcar Container Linux AMI.

instanceMetadataOptions.title: Instance metadata options
instanceMetadataOptions.description: Instance metadata options for the EC2 instances in the cluster.

httpTokens.title: HTTP tokens
httpTokens.description: The state of token usage for your instance metadata requests. If you set this parameter to `optional`, you can use either IMDSv1 or IMDSv2. If you set this parameter to `required`, you must use a IMDSv2 to access the instance metadata endpoint. Learn more at [What’s new in IMDSv2](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/configuring-instance-metadata-service.html).

internal.title: Internal
internal.description: For Giant Swarm internal use only, not stable, or not supported by UIs.

hashSalt.title: Hash salt
hashSalt.description: If specified, this token is used as a salt to the hash suffix of some resource names. Can be used to force-recreate some resources.

migration.title: Migration values
migration.description: Section used for migration of cluster from vintage to CAPI

irsaAdditionalDomain.title: IRSA additional domain
irsaAdditionalDomain.description: Additional domain to be added to IRSA trust relationship.

managementCluster.title: Management cluster
managementCluster.description: Name of the Cluster API cluster managing this workload cluster.
